name: EnvironmentalDna
description: This schema is designed for environmental or agricultural monitoring datasets. It includes several key attributes such as sample identifiers, sample types, geographic coordinates (latitude and longitude), and site descriptions. The schema also defines metadata fields for data validation, such as required entry values, accepted formats, and character encoding. It aims to support structured data collection and ensure interoperability across platforms through consistent attribute naming and semantic annotations.

EnvironmentalDna.name: EnvironmentalDna
EnvironmentalDna.description: This schema is designed for environmental or agricultural monitoring datasets. It includes several key attributes such as sample identifiers, sample types, geographic coordinates (latitude and longitude), and site descriptions. The schema also defines metadata fields for data validation, such as required entry values, accepted formats, and character encoding. It aims to support structured data collection and ensure interoperability across platforms through consistent attribute naming and semantic annotations.
EnvironmentalDna.title: Environmental DNA

analyst.name: analyst
analyst.description: Person who performed the analyses. Example: \"Jean Martin\"
analyst.title: Analyst

biocontrol_ability.name: biocontrol_ability
biocontrol_ability.description: Pathogen control capacity. Example: \"Fusarium oxysporum inhibition\"
biocontrol_ability.title: Biocontrol

dataset_doi.name: dataset_doi
dataset_doi.description: Persistent identifier for the dataset (Digital Object Identifier). Example: \"10.5281/zenodo.123456\"
dataset_doi.title: Dataset DOI

extraction_protocol.name: extraction_protocol
extraction_protocol.description: DNA extraction method. Example: \"DNeasy PowerSoil Kit\"
extraction_protocol.title: Extraction protocol

filter_size.name: filter_size
filter_size.description: Filter size for water samples (micrometers). Example: 0.22
filter_size.title: Filter size

library.name: library
library.description: Targeted gene region. Example: \"16S rRNA V4-V5\"
library.title: Amplicon/library

location_name.name: location_name
location_name.description: Sampling site description. Example: \"Experimental Field A, Versailles\"
location_name.title: Location name

merging_tool.name: merging_tool
merging_tool.description: Read merging tool for paired-end data. Example: \"FLASH v1.2.11\"
merging_tool.title: Merging tool

metadata_version.name: metadata_version
metadata_version.description: Version of the metadata schema used. Example: \"1.2\"
metadata_version.title: Metadata version

qc_protocol.name: qc_protocol
qc_protocol.description: Quality control procedure. Example: \"16S sequence verification by PCR\"
qc_protocol.title: QC protocol

ref_database.name: ref_database
ref_database.description: Taxonomic reference database name and version. Example: \"SILVA 138.1\"
ref_database.title: Reference database

sample_name.name: sample_name
sample_name.description: Unique identifier for each sample. Example: \"Soil_2023_SiteA_Rep1\"
sample_name.title: Sample name

sampler.name: sampler
sampler.description: Person who performed the sampling. Format: \"Firstname Lastname\". Example: \"Marie Dupon\"
sampler.title: Sampler

treatment_details.name: treatment_details
treatment_details.description: Applied experimental conditions. Example: \"Irrigation at 50% field capacity\"
treatment_details.title: Treatment details

AllCaps.description: Entries of any length with only capital letters
AllCaps.title: AllCaps

AlphaText1-50.description: Capital or lower case letters only, at least 1 character, and 50 characters max
AlphaText1-50.title: AlphaText1-50

AlphaText0-50.description: Capital or lower case letters only, 50 characters max
AlphaText0-50.title: AlphaText0-50

PhoneNumber.description: Phone number with international and area code component.
PhoneNumber.title: PhoneNumber

Latitude.description: Latitude in formats S30°15'45.678" or N12°30.999"
Latitude.title: Latitude

Longitude.description: Longitude in formats E30°15'45.678" or W90°00.000"
Longitude.title: Longitude

ISO_YYYY-DDD.description: Ordinal date (day number from the year)
ISO_YYYY-DDD.title: ISO_YYYY-DDD

ISO_YYYYDDD.description: Ordinal date (day number from the year)
ISO_YYYYDDD.title: ISO_YYYYDDD

ISO_YYYY-MM-DDTHH.MM.SS-hh.mm.description: Date and Time Combined (with Timezone Offset)
ISO_YYYY-MM-DDTHH.MM.SS-hh.mm.title: ISO_YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SS±hh:mm

ISO_HH.MM.SS.description: hour, minutes, seconds in 24 hour notation
ISO_HH.MM.SS.title: ISO_HH:MM:SS

HH.MM.SS.description: hour, minutes, seconds 12 hour notation AM/PM
HH.MM.SS.title: HH:MM:SS

WhitespaceMinimizedString.name: WhitespaceMinimizedString
WhitespaceMinimizedString.description: A string that has all whitespace trimmed off of beginning and end, and all internal whitespace segments reduced to single spaces. Whitespace includes x9 (tab), #xA (linefeed), and #xD (carriage return).

string.name: string
notes: In RDF serializations, a slot with range of string is treated as a literal or type xsd:string.   If you are authoring schemas in LinkML YAML, the type is referenced with the lower case "string".

integer.name: integer
notes: If you are authoring schemas in LinkML YAML, the type is referenced with the lower case "integer".

boolean.name: boolean
notes: If you are authoring schemas in LinkML YAML, the type is referenced with the lower case "boolean".

float.name: float
float.description: A real number that conforms to the xsd:float specification
notes: If you are authoring schemas in LinkML YAML, the type is referenced with the lower case "float".

double.name: double
double.description: A real number that conforms to the xsd:double specification
notes: If you are authoring schemas in LinkML YAML, the type is referenced with the lower case "double".

decimal.name: decimal
decimal.description: A real number with arbitrary precision that conforms to the xsd:decimal specification
notes: If you are authoring schemas in LinkML YAML, the type is referenced with the lower case "decimal".

time.name: time
time.description: A time object represents a (local) time of day, independent of any particular day
notes: URI is dateTime because OWL reasoners do not work with straight date or time
If you are authoring schemas in LinkML YAML, the type is referenced with the lower case "time".

date.name: date
date.description: a date (year, month and day) in an idealized calendar
notes: URI is dateTime because OWL reasoners don't work with straight date or time
If you are authoring schemas in LinkML YAML, the type is referenced with the lower case "date".

datetime.name: datetime
datetime.description: The combination of a date and time
notes: If you are authoring schemas in LinkML YAML, the type is referenced with the lower case "datetime".

date_or_datetime.name: date_or_datetime
date_or_datetime.description: Either a date or a datetime
notes: If you are authoring schemas in LinkML YAML, the type is referenced with the lower case "date_or_datetime".

uriorcurie.name: uriorcurie
notes: If you are authoring schemas in LinkML YAML, the type is referenced with the lower case "uriorcurie".

curie.name: curie
notes: If you are authoring schemas in LinkML YAML, the type is referenced with the lower case "curie".
comments: in RDF serializations this MUST be expanded to a URI
in non-RDF serializations MAY be serialized as the compact representation

uri.name: uri
notes: If you are authoring schemas in LinkML YAML, the type is referenced with the lower case "uri".
comments: in RDF serializations a slot with range of uri is treated as a literal or type xsd:anyURI unless it is an identifier or a reference to an identifier, in which case it is translated directly to a node

ncname.name: ncname
notes: If you are authoring schemas in LinkML YAML, the type is referenced with the lower case "ncname".

objectidentifier.name: objectidentifier
objectidentifier.description: A URI or CURIE that represents an object in the model.
notes: If you are authoring schemas in LinkML YAML, the type is referenced with the lower case "objectidentifier".
comments: Used for inheritance and type checking

nodeidentifier.name: nodeidentifier
nodeidentifier.description: A URI, CURIE or BNODE that represents a node in a model.
notes: If you are authoring schemas in LinkML YAML, the type is referenced with the lower case "nodeidentifier".

jsonpointer.name: jsonpointer
jsonpointer.description: A string encoding a JSON Pointer. The value of the string MUST conform to JSON Point syntax and SHOULD dereference to a valid object within the current instance document when encoded in tree form.
notes: If you are authoring schemas in LinkML YAML, the type is referenced with the lower case "jsonpointer".

jsonpath.name: jsonpath
jsonpath.description: A string encoding a JSON Path. The value of the string MUST conform to JSON Point syntax and SHOULD dereference to zero or more valid objects within the current instance document when encoded in tree form.
notes: If you are authoring schemas in LinkML YAML, the type is referenced with the lower case "jsonpath".

sparqlpath.name: sparqlpath
sparqlpath.description: A string encoding a SPARQL Property Path. The value of the string MUST conform to SPARQL syntax and SHOULD dereference to zero or more valid objects within the current instance document when encoded as RDF.
notes: If you are authoring schemas in LinkML YAML, the type is referenced with the lower case "sparqlpath".
